segment.source: Managing Software Updates for MED-V Workspaces
segment.target: Managing Software Updates for MED-V Workspaces

segment.source: Managing Software Updates for MED-V Workspaces
segment.target: Managing Software Updates for MED-V Workspaces

segment.source: Managing Software Updates for MED-V Workspaces
segment.target: Managing Software Updates for MED-V Workspaces

segment.source: You have several different options available to you for providing software updates for the applications in the deployed MED-V workspace.
segment.target: You have several different options available to you for providing software updates for the applications in the deployed MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For information about how to specify the configuration settings that define how MED-V receives automatic updates, see Managing Automatic Updates for MED-V Workspaces.
segment.target: For information about how to specify the configuration settings that define how MED-V receives automatic updates, see Managing Automatic Updates for MED-V Workspaces.

segment.source: Updating Software in a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: Updating Software in a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: Using an Electronic Software Distribution System
segment.target: Using an Electronic Software Distribution System

segment.source: If your organization uses an Electronic Software Distribution System (ESD) system to deploy software, you can use it to provide software updates for applications on MED-V workspaces just as you provide updates for applications on physical computers.
segment.target: If your organization uses an Electronic Software Distribution System (ESD) system to deploy software, you can use it to provide software updates for applications on MED-V workspaces just as you provide updates for applications on physical computers.

segment.source: Using Group Policy
segment.target: Using Group Policy

segment.source: If your organization deploys software by using Group Policy, you can use it to provide software updates for applications on MED-V workspaces just as you provide updates for applications on physical computers.
segment.target: If your organization deploys software by using Group Policy, you can use it to provide software updates for applications on MED-V workspaces just as you provide updates for applications on physical computers.

segment.source: Using Application Virtualization (APP-V)
segment.target: Using Application Virtualization (APP-V)

segment.source: If you use MED-V together with App-V, you can provide software updates to applications in the MED-V workspace by following the steps that are required by App-V for updating software.
segment.target: If you use MED-V together with App-V, you can provide software updates to applications in the MED-V workspace by following the steps that are required by App-V for updating software.

segment.source: For more information, see Application Virtualization (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=122939).
segment.target: For more information, see Application Virtualization (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=122939).

segment.source: Updating Software in the Core Image
segment.target: Updating Software in the Core Image

segment.source: Although not considered a MED-V best practice, you can install software updates to applications on the core image.
segment.target: Although not considered a MED-V best practice, you can install software updates to applications on the core image.

segment.source: After you have installed the updates, you can then redeploy the MED-V workspace back out to your enterprise just as you deployed it originally.
segment.target: After you have installed the updates, you can then redeploy the MED-V workspace back out to your enterprise just as you deployed it originally.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: We do not recommend this method of managing software updates.
segment.target: We do not recommend this method of managing software updates.

segment.source: In addition, if you update software in the core image and redeploy the MED-V workspace back out to your enterprise, first time setup must run again, and any data saved in the virtual machine is lost.
segment.target: In addition, if you update software in the core image and redeploy the MED-V workspace back out to your enterprise, first time setup must run again, and any data saved in the virtual machine is lost.
